data.title: Mac OS X Shortcut key: cmd + F1 (Move Focus to Next Window) not usable
data.body: OSX Shortcut key: `command + F1` (Move Focus to Next Window) was no longer work. Can not be switched vscode window. `command + F1` Key assignments have been added in the vscode side? At least until the vscode 1.0.0 was functioning. - VSCode Version: 1.0.1-insider - OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.4 (15E65) - Japanese locale Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open multiple vscode window 2. Check the `command + F1` key operation

data.title: "ext install " fails with EACCES error using corporate proxy

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I originally reported this on StackOverflow but it was suggested by Benjamin Pasero that I log this as an issue.

I am working behind a corporate firewall which has outgoing authentication by Active Directory username. When I try the "ext install " command, after a some time I get the message "Error connect EACCES 191.238.172.191:443".

I've tried setting the "http.proxy" value to all variations of FQDN and IP address,both with and without the "http://" prefix and also tried setting "http.proxyStrictSSL" both true and false, always with the same result.

There do not seem to be any settings to specify username and password or any other options for outgoing authentication.
- VSCode 
  Version 1.0.0
  Commit fa6d0f03813dfb9df4589c30121e9fcffa8a8ec8
  Date 2016-04-13T14:08:36.599Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1
- OS Version:
  Window 10.0.10856 

Steps to Reproduce:

Type
     {ctrl-P}ext{space}install{space}

data.title: Can't open sub-folder in a new window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14316 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder in vscode
2. One of the following:
3. a. Right click a sub-folder, Open with Code
4. b.1. Open a new vscode window
5. b.2. Explorer pane, Open Folder button
6. b.3. Select the sub-folder
7. Visual Studio Code will activate the already open window of the folder initially opened.

Prior to this release, I could open the sub-folder in the new window.

I used this as I wanted separate windows open, one for source code I'm working on, and another to easily navigate between headers in another window.

data.title: ./scripts/test.sh needs ./scripts/code.sh to run first
Test: Provide command to open most recently closed file/editor
data.body:
Test plan for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3989
- [x] Test Linux @isidorn 
- [x] Test Windows @bpasero 
- [x] Test OS X @kieferrm 

This feature is supposed to reopen working files that are removed from the working files list. It does not work for preview files that are not yet in the working files list. This feature contributes a command (<kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>t</kbd>) and a menu item in File > Open Recent.
### Basic test
1. Open 2 working files, A then B
2. Remove A then B from working files
3. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>t</kbd> should restore B
4. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>t</kbd> should restore A
### Basic test (close all files)
1. Open multiple working files, note the currently active file in the editor
2. Run command `workbench.files.action.closeAllFiles` (default: <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>k</kbd> <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>w</kbd>
3. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>t</kbd> should restore the previously active file
4. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>t</kbd> should restore the rest of the files (in no particular order)
### Interesting cases

I tried to cover a range of cases, here are some of the interesting ones:
- Split editors
- Removing a working file, reopening it and then attempting to restore (it should be skipped and the previously closed working file should be restored)
- Deleting files before they are scheduled to be reopened

data.title: Javascript symbol search / outline is truncated
Make the error message in the output window clickable to navigate to the error position.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open folder which contains node.js TS express project (or any other proj)
2. Configure tasks.json, tsconfig.json and launch.json to build and debug.
3. Build project with CTRL+SHIFT+B 
4. Verify output window.

Actual: Error message in the output window is not clickable to reach to the error position (Line number).
Expected: If output window is showing error message then make it clickable so that user can reach to the exact line number to fix the error.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14693663/c2cac3e6-0715-11e6-8ee4-06c410bfea0a.png)

data.title: Extension Development Host messes up layout after going to debug tab
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a VS Code extension following the [guide doc](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-hello-world)
2. Debug 'Launch Extension'
3. In the Dev Host click the debug tab to open it
4. Click Explorer tab, click search tab

Actual:
The layout of the explorer and search sections are not in the right place. Also if you click too fast from debug to explorer, it will not change the view to the explorer.

![extensiondevhost1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14693543/a0109138-0714-11e6-81b3-16e83bce30f3.PNG)

![extensiondevhost2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14693545/a61432b0-0714-11e6-8ba7-a4c0a89a0078.PNG)

data.title: Function completion does not work across multiple cursors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
_From @sparrc on April 20, 2016 5:10_

First off, thanks for the great vscode plugin!

Here's a full dummy script to reproduce my problem:

``` go
package main

import "bytes"

func main() {
    var buf bytes.Buffer
    buf.WriteString("mystring")
    var mylen int
    if true {
        mylen = 8
    } else {
        mylen = 8
    }
}
```

steps are:
1. select the first `8`
2. ctrl+d or cmd+d to select both `8` variables
3. begin typing `buf.Le...` and wait for completion of `buf.Len()` to appear
4. select `buf.Len()` with tab or enter

When I do this, only the first of the `8` variables gets completed to buf.Len()

I'm on OSX using VSCode 1.0

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#305_

data.title: Bad Japanese (ja) translation for "Select All Occurences of Find Match"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-insider

"Select All Occurences of Find Match" is currently translated as "一致項目のすべてのオカレンスを選択".
But it should be "すべての出現箇所を選択". At least, "オカレンス" is not a Japanese word.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311400/14692076/ccad8040-078f-11e6-8da8-096ddf98f9d2.png)

data.title: Controls are not visible when user try to perform uninstall action on the selected item from the installed extension list.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and press F1 to launch command palette.
2. Enter extension keyword and select installed extension option.
3. It will display the list of the installed extensions .
4. Select any item from the extension list and verify controls for "Readme", "License" or "Uninstall extension".

Actual: Controls are not visible.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14690612/b7cb128e-0701-11e6-84e6-2d299af1cde7.png)

Expected: Controls should be visible for user to perform action on the selected item.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14690520/53d0d764-0701-11e6-9039-d8155ae20a1f.png)
